bibl.title: Statues Taxes in Roman Egypt.
bibl.note: The levy (attested by ostraka from Syene - Elephantine and Thebes) supported the provision not of cult statues but of images that were intended to be set in temples, theoretically as offerings to the deity, but were also transported in procession as ritual objects on feast days.
bibl.seg: Fishwick Duncan, Statues Taxes in Roman Egypt.

The levy (attested by ostraka from Syene - Elephantine and Thebes) supported the provision not of cult statues but of images that were intended to be set in temples, theoretically as offerings to the deity, but were also transported in procession as ritual objects on feast days.
